item.title: ESP8266 Connecting to WIFI and Making HTTP Requests using MicroPython
item.description: There are two WiFi interfaces, one for the station (when the ESP8266 connects to a router) and one for the access point (for other devices to connect to the ESP8266). Here is an example to connect ESP8266 to your wifi router. >>> import network >>> sta_if = network.WLAN(network.STA_IF) >>> sta_if.active() # check if station mode is activated or not.

item.title: ESP8266 Deploying Micropython and Using REPL
item.description: ESP8266 The ESP8266 is a low-cost Wi-Fi microchip with full TCP/IP stack and microcontroller capability produced by Espressif Systems. One of the coolest things about this cip is it can run Micropython. If you are new to programming or hardware/embedded systems and want to get into those, ESP8266 is a good way to get started.
